Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the animation of game elements that are animated.
    Author:
    Osher Cohen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animation(java.lang.String fileName, int frameQuantity, int frameSkip)
      Constructs the animation object which is used to store and control the animation.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Image getImage()
      This is used to return the image which represents the current frame of the animation.
      boolean isPlaying()
      This is used to indicate if the animation is playing or not.
      void loopAnimation()
      This causes the animation to loop.
      void playAnimation()
      This is used to start the animation.
      void update()
      This is used to update the state of the animation.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.lang.String fileName,
         int frameQuantity,
         int frameSkip)
        Constructs the animation object which is used to store and control the animation.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the sequence of frames in the animation
        frameQuantity - This is used to store the amount of frames in the animation
        frameSkip - This indicates how many game frames should be skipped before switching to the next animation frame.

    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        public java.awt.Image getImage()
        This is used to return the image which represents the current frame of the animation.
        Returns:
        Image An Image object that is a reference to the image that represents the current frame of the animation.

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        This is used to indicate if the animation is playing or not.
        Returns:
        True if the animation is playing. Otherwise it returns False.

      • loopAnimation

        public void loopAnimation()
        This causes the animation to loop.

      • playAnimation

        public void playAnimation()
        This is used to start the animation.

      • update

        public void update()
        This is used to update the state of the animation.
